alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 7:31AM PST until January 18 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...INCREASING SNOW INTO THE AFTERNOON... .A weather system will spread increasing snow into the region today. The snow will become heavy in the Cascades, eastern third of Washington, and the Idaho Panhandle with snow rates of near an inch per hour expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 to 12 inches in the valleys and 12 to 18 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Davenport, Worley, Airway Heights, Fruitland, Tiger, Cheney, Downtown Spokane, Chewelah, Orin-Rice Road, Clark Fork, Bonners Ferry, Rockford, Newport, Plummer, Moscow, Hayden, Kettle Falls, Colville, Metaline Falls, Priest River, Genesee, Metaline, Sandpoint, Athol, Northport, Eastport, Potlatch, Spokane Valley, Springdale-Hunters Road, Post Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Ione, Fairfield, Deer Park, Coeur d`Alene, and Flowery Trail Road. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates near an inch per hour forecast during the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
